ischaemic.ISCH1: Some glomeruli show mild ischaemic-type capillary deflation.
ischaemic.ISCH2: Some glomeruli marked ischaemic-type capillary deflation with thickening of Bowman's capsule.

capillary_double_contours.CG0: No capillary wall double contours are seen on light microscopy (cg0).
capillary_double_contours.CG1: A few segmental capillary wall double contours are seen (cg1b).
capillary_double_contours.CG2: Capillary wall double contours are seen affecting up to 50% of capillary walls (cg2).
capillary_double_contours.CG3: Capillary wall double contours are seen affecting >50% of capillary walls (cg3).

acute_tubular_injury.ATI1: There is mild acute tubular injury.
acute_tubular_injury.ATI2: There is severe acute tubular injury, with granular casts.
acute_tubular_injury.ATI_micro: There acute tubular injury with tubular epithelial cell cytoplasmic microvacuolation.
acute_tubular_injury.ATI micro: There is mild acute tubular injury.

tubulitis.T0: Tubulitis is not present in >1 focus of non-severely atrophic tubules (t0).
tubulitis.T1: Mild tubulitis is present in >1 focus of non-severely atrophic tubules (t1).
tubulitis.T2: Moderate tubulitis is present in >1 focus of non-severely atrophic tubules (t2).
tubulitis.T3: Severe tubulitis is present in >1 focus of non-severely atrophic tubules (t3).

inflammation.I3_I-IFTA1: There is a chronic interstitial inflammatory infiltrate, that affects >50% of non-scarred cortex and 10-25% of scarred cortex (i3, i-IFTA1).
inflammation.I0_I-IFTA2: There is a chronic interstitial inflammatory infiltrate, that affects <10% of non-scarred cortex and 25-50% of scarred cortex (i0, i-IFTA2).
inflammation.I1_I-IFTA2: There is a chronic interstitial inflammatory infiltrate, that affects 10-25% of non-scarred cortex and 25-50% of scarred cortex (i1, i-IFTA2).
inflammation.I2_I-IFTA2: There is a chronic interstitial inflammatory infiltrate, that affects 25-50% of non-scarred cortex and 25-50% of scarred cortex (i2, i-IFTA2).

total_inflammation.TI0: Total cortical interstitial inflammation amount to <10% of cortex (ti0).
total_inflammation.TI1: Total cortical interstitial inflammation amount to 10-25% of cortex (ti1).
total_inflammation.TI2: Total cortical interstitial inflammation amount to 25-50% of cortex (ti2).
total_inflammation.TI3: Total cortical interstitial inflammation amount to >50% of cortex (ti3).

arteries.A_pattern: {} arteries are present in the sampled kidney.
arteries.A1: One artery is present in the sampled kidney.
arteries.A2: Two arteries are present in the sampled kidney.
arteries.A3: Three arteries are present in the sampled kidney.

chronic_allograft_arteriopathy.CAA0: No features of chronic allograft arteriopathy are present.
chronic_allograft_arteriopathy.CAA1: Features of chronic allograft arteriopathy (inflammatory cells in the thickened intima and/or lack of elastic lamina reduplication) are present.

peritubular_capillaritis.PTC0: Peritubular capillary inflammation is present in <10% of cortical peritubular capillaries (ptc0).
peritubular_capillaritis.PTC1: Peritubular capillary inflammation with a maximum of 3-4 cells is present in >10% of cortical peritubular capillaries (ptc1).
peritubular_capillaritis.PTC2: Peritubular capillary inflammation with a maximum of 9 cells is present in >10% of cortical peritubular capillaries (ptc2).
peritubular_capillaritis.PTC3: Peritubular capillary inflammation with 10 or more cells is present in >10% of cortical peritubular capillaries (ptc3).

sv40.SV40_1: SV40: positive nuclear staining in a small number of tubules.
sv40.SV40_2: SV40: positive nuclear staining in many tubules.

immunofluorescence.FR0: Frozen sampled received but not examined

conclusion.ATI_micro: Acute tubular injury with tubular epithelial cell cytoplasmic microvacuolation

comment.EM: The electron microscopy component of this report is not currently UKAS accredited due to a change in equipment.
comment.DP: This case was reported using the Digital Pathology Whole Slide Acquisition. The laboratory is not UKAS accredited for this test.
comment.NR: There is no evidence of rejection.
comment.SC?: The cause for the scarring is not apparent.
comment.NRNR: There is no evidence of rejection or of recurrent disease.
comment.CR?: The cause for the recent rise in creatinine is not clear.
comment.CRSUB?: The cause for the suboptimal creatinine is not clear.
comment.MVI+: MVI above the histological threshold, without circulating DSA and with negative C4d staining in peritubular capillaries has been observed in patients with normal or abnormal kidney function. This is a purely descriptive phenotype, and the cause remains unclear. Further research is necessary to determine the prevalence, the causes and related biological processes and best treatment for this pattern. These cases may represent alloreactive T cell mediated responses; autoreactive or alloreactive non-HLA antibodies; primary NK cell activation through missing self; viral infection; other mechanisms of innate immune activation; ischemia reperfusion injury, etc.
comment.ATI_micro: Tubular epithelial microvacuolation is not specific but has been described in acute CNI toxicity. Other associations include IVIG, plasma expanders and radiolabeled contrast media.
comment.UTI: In view of the neutrophilic tubulitis, please exclude a urinary tract infection.
